title: It’s A Date!
body:
Summary: Phil runs a hotel owned by his family, and Dan is one of the employees who works for him. Unfortunately, it’s a bad day for Dan as he works one of their busiest days at the hotel. But, the day ends with an unexpected surprise.

Genre: AU, Fluff

Word Count: 1,568

Normally, Dan loves his job working at the hotel owned by Phil Lester. He’s been working here for over two years now. His job is to basically make sure that everything is cleaned and working, and reporting back to Phil Lester after he’s done a run through of the entire hotel.

Today, however, has just been a bad day for Dan. The hotel is busy for some reason. There’s two parties going on at once which means there are little kids running around everywhere and breaking things, and Dan has to deal with angry parents even though it’s Phil who should be dealing with that stuff.

“There you are!”

Dan groans as soon as he hears Phil’s voice. It’s the first time all day that he’s been able to sit down and actually rest for a bit without dealing with any angry hotel guests, and of course Phil has to ruin that. Dan also didn’t want to be seen by Phil, especially because he knows that he’s going to get yelled at for slacking on the job, with Phil being the perfectionist that he is.

“What are you doing up here, Dan? Oh, sorry, are you on your break?” Phil asks as he walks up to Dan, who’s currently sitting cross-legged on the floor with his head in his hands..

“My break isn’t for another hour,” Dan mumbles, rubbing his forehead.

“Why are you sitting down?” Phil asks, blinking a few times. “Today’s a busy day, and there’s a lot to do.”

“Like I don’t know that, Phil?” Dan asks, finally looking up at Phil. “I’ve had to deal with those annoying little brats all day and angry parents. I’m exhausted and it’s barely twelve in the afternoon! Not to mention, I’ve got a headache coming on, but that doesn’t matter. You’ve come to tell me you need something?”

“Well, yes… but, why didn’t you tell me that you have a headache?” Phil asks.

“Because we’re busy,” Dan replies, blinking a few times. “I know how much of a perfectionist you are, and I didn’t… I didn’t want to make you upset or anything for slacking on the job.”

“Dan, stop. I may be a perfectionist but I care about my employees. You should have told me sooner, okay? I want you to be able to come to me if you don’t feel well. Come with me. We have something for that headache of yours at the front desk,” Phil says, helping Dan up from the floor.

Dan stands there for a second before finally following Phil.

“I didn’t know we had this at the front desk,” Dan says as Phil pulls out some tylenol from the drawer.

“Really? Did no one tell you?” Phil asks, raising his eyebrows as he looks at Dan. “We have all kinds of stuff for employees at the front desk. All you have to do is walk up and ask whoever’s working at the time and they’ll give you what you need, with reason. Hell, we even have tampons up here for the woman.”

Dan can’t help but laugh, though he instantly regrets it when his head starts pounding again. Dan whines, and quickly grabs a hold of his head. “Fuck, that hurts. Don’t make me laugh,”

Phil chuckles and shakes his head at Dan. “Sorry,” he says.

“Excuse me, do you work here?”

Dan blinks a few times as he looks over and sees a not-so-happy older woman. “Yes?”

“I’ve got a bone to pick with you-” she begins.

Dan closes his eyes, trying to keep himself composed. He just can’t get a break today, and at this point… all he really wants to do right now is just break down and let all of his frustration out. Usually Dan is never like this, especially towards their guests. He’s usually smiley and cheerful. Today is just a bad day.

“Ma’am, excuse me. He’s actually going on his break right now,” Phil says, handing Dan the tylenol as well as a bottle of water. “PJ’s just now coming in so I’ll have him deal with guests, Dan. Take your break, go to your room for about an hour and then come back down. Let me know when you’re back.”

“You want me to take an hour break? But, we’re so busy today,” Dan frowns as he looks up at Phil.

“I’ve got it handled, alright?” Phil assures him. “Now, go…” He gently shoos Dan away, smiling. Phil turns and looks at the woman who’s impatiently waiting. “Sorry about that. What’s the problem, ma’am?”

As Dan is walking up to his room, he passes PJ. “Oh, hey. Good luck down there,” he says.

“Busy day today?”

“It’s a madhouse down there,” Dan says. “Two birthday parties. Screaming children. Angry parents.”

“Shit. We’re just a hotel. We’re not even popular!” PJ complains as he continues walking.

Dan smiles a little to himself, before finally making it to his bedroom. Finally. Peace and quiet time.

Dan’s hour goes by way too quickly, and before he knows it, he’s thrown back into the madness, but luckily Phil pulls him aside before he has to deal with anymore angry guests.

“I thought I was supposed to come find you when I was done with my break?” Dan asks.

“Uh, sorry. But, I want you to do a run through of the hotel,” Phil tells him.

“Are you sure? Isn’t it a little early for that?” Dan asks, raising his eyebrows at Phil.

“Dan, you’ve been working hard all morning and dealing with guests. I want you to actually be able to do what you’re supposed to be doing. Besides, PJ’s been handling the guests since your break,” Phil says.

Dan smiles and then shakes his head. “I just don’t understand how that man has so much patience, even when he’s being yelled at by an angry mum he still is so kind and polite,”

“S’why I hired him,” Phil chuckles. “By the way, what’s your favorite type of pizza?”

“Uh,” Dan blinks a few times. “That’s an odd question?”

“Dan,” Phil laughs. “Come on, just answer the simple question. Favorite pizza?”

“I don’t know, Phil. Pizza is pizza. I’ll eat any type of pizza, honestly. Why are you asking?” Dan asks.

“No reason. Just, trust me. Shout if you need anything,” Phil smiles at Dan before walking away.

Dan raises his eyebrows as he watches Phil before turning around and continuing down the hallway, and then he runs into Louise. “Hey, Lou. Didn’t know you were working today?”

“Unfortunately, did you just see Phil? Did he ask you what your favorite pizza is too?” Louise asks.

“Yeah,” Dan nods. “What’s up with that? Is he planning something?”

“Lord knows with that man,” Louise says before walking into one of the rooms.

It’s around 5pm when Dan finally understands why Phil was asking his employees their favorite pizzas, because he wanted to order everyone dinner to make up for their unusual busy day.

“You really shouldn’t have done this Phil,” Dan says as he stands with Phil in the break room with the other employees. “We’re just doing our jobs.”

“I know. But, we usually aren’t that busy, and everybody did such a wonderful job today,” Phil says. “Those birthday parties really threw us off guard, but still… my employees took care of everything,”

Dan smiles. “Yeah, we really have a nice team here, don’t we?”

“Hell yeah we do, and I’m so proud of everyone here,” Phil smiles as he looks around, before looking back at Dan. “I’m glad you decided to come. I wanted to ask you something.”

Dan freezes, before looking up at Phil. “Oh no. You’re going to fire me, aren’t you?”

“What?” Phil’s eyes widen. “No, God no. Of course I’m not firing you! You’re one of our best. Christ, Dan.” He sighs softly. “I wanted to ask if, maybe… you’d like to hang out with me sometime? Outside of work?”

“You mean, like… uh, a date?” Dan asks, biting his lip nervously.

“If that’s okay with you? If not, we can… totally just hang out as friends,” Phil says.

“No, I’m perfectly fine with it being a date. I just thought that was like, against the rules or something?” Dan asks. “You know, employees dating their bosses?”

Phil chuckles. “Well, that’s not a rule here. I’d just… really like to hang out with you outside of work,”

“Yeah. Y-Yeah, that would be… that would be awesome,” Dan smiles, unable to stop himself from blushing. Phil Lester is asking him out on a date, which is something he never expected to happen, but he’s happy that it did happen, especially when he’s always secretly had a crush on Phil.

“Great, it’s a date! I’ll text you later then?” Phil asks.

“Yes, definitely…” Dan nods quickly. “I’m looking forward to our date, Phil.”

Phil smiles at Dan. “Yeah. I-I should go talk to the other employees,” he says, before shyly walking away.

“Did I just hear what I think I heard?”

Dan blinks a few times as he looks over, and sighs when he sees Louise. “Were you eavesdropping?”

“No, I wasn’t eavesdropping,” Louise quickly defends herself. “I just happened to walk by when I heard none other than Phil Lester ask you out on a date, and you said yes!”

“Shut up, Lou,” Dan mumbles, looking down as his cheeks turn even redder.

Dan groans as soon as he hears Phil’s voice. It’s the first time all day that he’s been able to sit down and actually rest for a bit without dealing with any angry hotel guests, and of course Phil has to ruin that. Dan also didn’t want to be seen by Phil, especially because he knows that he’s going to get yelled at for slacking on the job, with Phil being the perfectionist that he is.

“What are you doing up here, Dan? Oh, sorry, are you on your break?” Phil asks as he walks up to Dan, who’s currently sitting cross-legged on the floor with his head in his hands..

“My break isn’t for another hour,” Dan mumbles, rubbing his forehead.

“Why are you sitting down?” Phil asks, blinking a few times. “Today’s a busy day, and there’s a lot to do.”

“Like I don’t know that, Phil?” Dan asks, finally looking up at Phil. “I’ve had to deal with those annoying little brats all day and angry parents. I’m exhausted and it’s barely twelve in the afternoon! Not to mention, I’ve got a headache coming on, but that doesn’t matter. You’ve come to tell me you need something?”

“Well, yes… but, why didn’t you tell me that you have a headache?” Phil asks.

“Because we’re busy,” Dan replies, blinking a few times. “I know how much of a perfectionist you are, and I didn’t… I didn’t want to make you upset or anything for slacking on the job.”

“Dan, stop. I may be a perfectionist but I care about my employees. You should have told me sooner, okay? I want you to be able to come to me if you don’t feel well. Come with me. We have something for that headache of yours at the front desk,” Phil says, helping Dan up from the floor.

Dan stands there for a second before finally following Phil.

“I didn’t know we had this at the front desk,” Dan says as Phil pulls out some tylenol from the drawer.

“Really? Did no one tell you?” Phil asks, raising his eyebrows as he looks at Dan. “We have all kinds of stuff for employees at the front desk. All you have to do is walk up and ask whoever’s working at the time and they’ll give you what you need, with reason. Hell, we even have tampons up here for the woman.”

Dan can’t help but laugh, though he instantly regrets it when his head starts pounding again. Dan whines, and quickly grabs a hold of his head. “Fuck, that hurts. Don’t make me laugh,”

Phil chuckles and shakes his head at Dan. “Sorry,” he says.

“Excuse me, do you work here?”

Dan blinks a few times as he looks over and sees a not-so-happy older woman. “Yes?”

“I’ve got a bone to pick with you-” she begins.

Dan closes his eyes, trying to keep himself composed. He just can’t get a break today, and at this point… all he really wants to do right now is just break down and let all of his frustration out. Usually Dan is never like this, especially towards their guests. He’s usually smiley and cheerful. Today is just a bad day.

“Ma’am, excuse me. He’s actually going on his break right now,” Phil says, handing Dan the tylenol as well as a bottle of water. “PJ’s just now coming in so I’ll have him deal with guests, Dan. Take your break, go to your room for about an hour and then come back down. Let me know when you’re back.”

“You want me to take an hour break? But, we’re so busy today,” Dan frowns as he looks up at Phil.

“I’ve got it handled, alright?” Phil assures him. “Now, go…” He gently shoos Dan away, smiling. Phil turns and looks at the woman who’s impatiently waiting. “Sorry about that. What’s the problem, ma’am?”

As Dan is walking up to his room, he passes PJ. “Oh, hey. Good luck down there,” he says.

“Busy day today?”

“It’s a madhouse down there,” Dan says. “Two birthday parties. Screaming children. Angry parents.”

“Shit. We’re just a hotel. We’re not even popular!” PJ complains as he continues walking.

Dan smiles a little to himself, before finally making it to his bedroom. Finally. Peace and quiet time.

Dan’s hour goes by way too quickly, and before he knows it, he’s thrown back into the madness, but luckily Phil pulls him aside before he has to deal with anymore angry guests.

“I thought I was supposed to come find you when I was done with my break?” Dan asks.

“Uh, sorry. But, I want you to do a run through of the hotel,” Phil tells him.

“Are you sure? Isn’t it a little early for that?” Dan asks, raising his eyebrows at Phil.

“Dan, you’ve been working hard all morning and dealing with guests. I want you to actually be able to do what you’re supposed to be doing. Besides, PJ’s been handling the guests since your break,” Phil says.

Dan smiles and then shakes his head. “I just don’t understand how that man has so much patience, even when he’s being yelled at by an angry mum he still is so kind and polite,”

“S’why I hired him,” Phil chuckles. “By the way, what’s your favorite type of pizza?”

“Uh,” Dan blinks a few times. “That’s an odd question?”

“Dan,” Phil laughs. “Come on, just answer the simple question. Favorite pizza?”

“I don’t know, Phil. Pizza is pizza. I’ll eat any type of pizza, honestly. Why are you asking?” Dan asks.

“No reason. Just, trust me. Shout if you need anything,” Phil smiles at Dan before walking away.

Dan raises his eyebrows as he watches Phil before turning around and continuing down the hallway, and then he runs into Louise. “Hey, Lou. Didn’t know you were working today?”

“Unfortunately, did you just see Phil? Did he ask you what your favorite pizza is too?” Louise asks.

“Yeah,” Dan nods. “What’s up with that? Is he planning something?”

“Lord knows with that man,” Louise says before walking into one of the rooms.

It’s around 5pm when Dan finally understands why Phil was asking his employees their favorite pizzas, because he wanted to order everyone dinner to make up for their unusual busy day.

“You really shouldn’t have done this Phil,” Dan says as he stands with Phil in the break room with the other employees. “We’re just doing our jobs.”

“I know. But, we usually aren’t that busy, and everybody did such a wonderful job today,” Phil says. “Those birthday parties really threw us off guard, but still… my employees took care of everything,”

Dan smiles. “Yeah, we really have a nice team here, don’t we?”

“Hell yeah we do, and I’m so proud of everyone here,” Phil smiles as he looks around, before looking back at Dan. “I’m glad you decided to come. I wanted to ask you something.”

Dan freezes, before looking up at Phil. “Oh no. You’re going to fire me, aren’t you?”

“What?” Phil’s eyes widen. “No, God no. Of course I’m not firing you! You’re one of our best. Christ, Dan.” He sighs softly. “I wanted to ask if, maybe… you’d like to hang out with me sometime? Outside of work?”

“You mean, like… uh, a date?” Dan asks, biting his lip nervously.

“If that’s okay with you? If not, we can… totally just hang out as friends,” Phil says.

“No, I’m perfectly fine with it being a date. I just thought that was like, against the rules or something?” Dan asks. “You know, employees dating their bosses?”

Phil chuckles. “Well, that’s not a rule here. I’d just… really like to hang out with you outside of work,”

“Yeah. Y-Yeah, that would be… that would be awesome,” Dan smiles, unable to stop himself from blushing. Phil Lester is asking him out on a date, which is something he never expected to happen, but he’s happy that it did happen, especially when he’s always secretly had a crush on Phil.

“Great, it’s a date! I’ll text you later then?” Phil asks.

“Yes, definitely…” Dan nods quickly. “I’m looking forward to our date, Phil.”

Phil smiles at Dan. “Yeah. I-I should go talk to the other employees,” he says, before shyly walking away.

“Did I just hear what I think I heard?”

Dan blinks a few times as he looks over, and sighs when he sees Louise. “Were you eavesdropping?”

“No, I wasn’t eavesdropping,” Louise quickly defends herself. “I just happened to walk by when I heard none other than Phil Lester ask you out on a date, and you said yes!”

“Shut up, Lou,” Dan mumbles, looking down as his cheeks turn even redder.
trail.content_abstract:
Summary: Phil runs a hotel owned by his family, and Dan is one of the employees who works for him. Unfortunately, it’s a bad day for Dan as he works one of their busiest days at the hotel. But, the day ends with an unexpected surprise.

Genre: AU, Fluff

Word Count: 1,568

blog.description: Treat People With Respect | Unpopular Opinions Welcome

summary: Sorry but if Dan doesn’t like being a youtuber anymore then he could delete his channel and get a real job if he wanted to lmao....
question: Sorry but if Dan doesn’t like being a youtuber anymore then he could delete his channel and get a real job if he wanted to lmao. You know one that won’t let him take 3 whole months off so he can do nothing. I’m not hating on him but these youtubers don’t know how easy they have it. They should try working a real job and then let’s see how much they want to complain about how hard it is to sit in front of a camera and play video games or talk about memes and get a ton of money for it.
answer: I agree with this statement regarding YouTubers. I think it’s probably not so cut and dry and easy for Dan to just determine what he wants from YouTube going forward because it involves making a lot of big decisions that will effect himself and others, but generally when YouTubers whine about their jobs or try to get their audience to pity them (not saying this is what Dan’s doing), especially when they do it while pedaling merch, it make me roll my eyes. I have an irl friend who is pretty successful in the entertainment industry and they don’t just get long periods of time off or have the flexibility that YouTubers do. Like the rest of us, that person has to meet deadlines and balance multiple projects continuously. All the jobs I have had have involved even less flexibility. It concerns me when some of them seem to take advantage of their young audiences and make them feel like they need to be spending their parents money or their favorites will be poor, when those same favorites are probably making more than their parents. I think the whole parasocial relationship aspect of YouTube is really interesting, but also really dangerous as there can be a big imbalance of power. If Dan started trying to get his audience to pity him or, for example, put membership on his channel while not offering regular content, I would stop supporting him immediately, but to be honest, I think most of the unhealthy attitudes I see come from the phandom itself and members policing other members.

blog.description:
Phandom drama? It's more likely than you think.

.

My ask box is always open if you need a place to be dramatic, share theories, conspiracies, opinions, or general grievances. Fire away, my babies. Nothing is off limits. (Except for the things that are.)

.

summary: Oh my god. When they were playing cards against humanity and phil said cheeky bum sex, he said "it can still lead to...
question: Oh my god. When they were playing cards against humanity and phil said cheeky bum sex, he said "it can still lead to pregnancy... In certain situations". I just realised he was talking about mpreg! I'm such an idiot HAHAHA!
answer: I’m probably completely certain that’s not what he meant. But okay.

blog.name: phanfictioncatalogue
blog.title: phanfiction catalogue
blog.description:
mobile users, click here!

please refer to our FAQ first.

Our goal is to create an alphabetized library of every phanfiction in the phandom. Besides that, we compile masterlists of different genres that are scheduled for posting every few days, and help find fics that have been mislocated.

title: Manchester Masterlist
body:
A Christmas Miracle (ao3) - alphalester

Summary: Dan’s Family ditch him for Christmas so Phil invites him to Manchester to spend it with phil and his family. Phil never corrects his mother when she calls them a couple and they decide to play along until after Christmas.

All The Little Lights - waverlysangels

Summary: Dan and Phil are on the Manchester eye, Phil is scared, Dan shakes the gondola, fluff ensues.

A Rush at the Beginning (ao3) - goldsteps

Summary: It’s Dan’s last day in Manchester, and Phil takes him on the Manchester Eye.

Cherry on Top - adayinthelifeofphan

Summary: Dan and Phil meet for the first time (set in 2009).

Coming (Out) To Manchester (ao3) - BookRockShooter

Summary: Dan and Phil decide to end their Manchester show with a little surprise.

Eskimo Kisses and Christmas Wishes - philsdrill

Summary: Dan gets a nasty surprise when he at last comes out to his family just before Christmas. Alone and out in the cold, he makes the trip up to Manchester where he spends Christmas with Phil and his family. It’s a struggle for Dan, being in such a loving family environment when he has just been evicted from his own, but Phil does his best to look after Dan and cheer him up as best he can.

Give Me At Shot At The Night (ao3) -goldfishsunglasses

Summary:

“and then you kissed me…”
inspired by shot at the night-the killers

Long Train Is Long (ao3) - watergator

Summary: On the morning of October 19th 2009, eighteen year old Dan steps on the train to Manchester to chase his moon river.

Nostalgia - phananddragonsfics

Summary: Dan and Phil reminisce their time in Manchester while filming a segment for “Giving the People What They Want”

On the Manchester Eye - twowrongsmakemewrite

Summary: They make a Valentine’s Day video with the intention of trolling the Phan shippers, but Dan realizes he doesn’t want it to be a joke.

Pride - ineverhadmyinternetphase

Summary: It’s Manchester Pride, and Dan is feeling a little insecure.

Resistance - amazingdanielhowell, insertyoutuberquotehere

Summary: Dan moved up to Manchester after his already successful parents got a promotion and moved to be closer to work. Dan is lonely seeing as his parents are always too busy for him. Since birth, he’s had a life plan that he is to follow exactly, though he wants to create his own future. He meets a really quiet kid, Phil, who never talks to anyone and is known as “Freaky Phil” by everyone in school. Dan decides to give the boy a chance, though Phil isn’t exactly the easiest person to talk to…

The Manchester Eye (ao3) - illustriousphan (orphan_account)

Summary: 2009 Dan and Phil visit the Manchester Eye.

To This Love (There Will Never Be an End) - avatarin3d

Summary: Dan and Phil go back to Manchester to reminisce on the early days.

What Are You Doing Here? (fanfiction.net) - who tf knows

Summary: Dan moves from Reading to Manchester and he knows his boyfriend, Phil, lives in Manchester, but he has no idea where… until he goes to school at least. Punk!Phil Pastel!Dan fluffy high school oneshot.

What Stranger Miracles (ao3) - iihappydaysii

Summary: Dan and Phil meet for the first time in Manchester and try to figure out what they are to each other. (Or why Phil believes in fate and Dan believes in free will.)
